alert.note: Alert for Mecklenburg (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 17 at 5:30PM EST until December 17 at 8:00PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Mecklenburg County, North Carolina. * WHEN...Until 830 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Very minor flooding is occurring in low-lying areas along Little Sugar Creek. Ponding of water will continue in adjacent urban areas through mid-evening. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 530 PM EST, Gauge reports indicated heavy rain this afternoon has led to rises on area creeks and streams. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Portions of the Little Sugar Creek Greenway may remain underwater for a time this evening, as rainfall rates gradually taper off. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding or landslides threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed.
